text.content:
The Basics

Roll: 2d6 + Stat
10+: Full success
7-9: Partial success, pay a price
6-: Failure, Overlord makes a move

Hope/Despair: Roll 3d6, keep 2 highest/lowest

Stats

StatRepresentsUsed For
BloodMight, violence, physicalityOvercome, Finish Them (kill)
CourageBravery, determination, heartKeep Them Busy, Finish Them (intimidate)
GraceAgility, charm, finesseGet Away, Talk Sense (trick), Finish Them (outmaneuver)
SenseAwareness, intelligence, cunningLook Closely, Talk Sense (plan), Finish Them (disable)
WisdomExperience, empathy, insightSpeak Softly, Talk Sense (appeal), Finish Them (convert)

Basic Moves

Finish Them

Trigger: Attempt to defeat an enemy you hold Advantage over
Roll: Based on your approach:

  • Kill them → +Blood
  • Force retreat → +Courage
  • Outsmart/terrify → +Grace
  • Disable/knockout → +Sense
  • Convert them → +Wisdom

10+: You succeed completely
7-9: Deal damage, lose Advantage
6-: Lose Advantage, face retaliation

Requires Advantage: Teamwork, surprise, superior position, enemy hesitation

Overcome (Blood)

Trigger: Avoid, redirect, or prevent harm
10+: Stop the threat completely
7-9: Pay a price for success OR create temporary solution

Keep Them Busy (Courage)

Trigger: Distract or buy time
7+: Create Advantage for allies, attention on you
9-: They retaliate when time is up

Get Away (Grace)

Trigger: Get somewhere out of reach/sight
10+: Choose 2, 7-9: Choose 1:

  • Get there quickly (avoid harm)
  • Get there quietly (no attention)
  • Bring someone with you

Look Closely (Sense)

Trigger: Examine situation/location closely
7+: Ask 3 questions, 6-: Ask 1:

  • What's going on here?
  • What's hidden or suspicious?
  • How could _____ hurt/help me?
  • What are they doing/will do next?
  • What happens if I _____?

9-: Learn one answer "the hard way"

Speak Softly (Wisdom)

Trigger: Quiet chat with someone
Ask 3 questions:

  • What can they tell me about _____?
  • What were/will they be doing?
  • What should I be wary of?
  • What do they want? How can we help?
  • What would they have us do?

10+: All answers honest
9-: One answer unhelpful
6-: One answer is false

Talk Sense (Grace/Sense/Wisdom)

Trigger: Ask someone for help with conviction
Choose approach:

  • Detail plan → +Sense
  • Appeal to emotions → +Wisdom
  • Impress/trick → +Grace

7+: They do as asked
9-: You owe them a favor
6-: Expensive favor OR they can't/won't help

Bonds System

Creating Bonds

  • Forge a Bond: Share meaningful experience, write one sentence
  • Maximum: 3 Bonds per person
  • Bond Examples: "Saved my life in the goblin caves," "Taught me their people's customs"

Using Bonds

  • Work together with Bonds: Roll with Hope (3d6, keep 2 highest)
  • Pay prices: Bonded ally can pay price for you instead
  • No Bonds: Roll with Despair when working together (3d6, keep 2 lowest)

Breaking Bonds

  • Harm ally: Immediately erase one Bond
  • Zero Bonds: Can't work together effectively

Damage & Health

Taking Damage

  1. Choose a stat and mark it damaged
  2. Damaged stat: Roll with Despair when using it
  3. All stats damaged + more damage: You're Taken Out

Being Taken Out

  • Describe what happens to you
  • Can't help for rest of scene
  • Can the fellowship save you? How?

Healing

  • Fill Your Belly: Use Food between scenes to heal 1 damage
  • Share a meal: One person heals +1 extra damage
  • Recover: Spend week in safety, heal all damage, reset all Gear

Common Gear Tags

Weapon Tags

  • Ammo X: Limited uses, specify when empty
  • Melee/Ranged/Thrown: Attack ranges
  • Reload: Can refill Ammo during Recover
  • Slow: Can't Keep Them Busy or Get Away with this
  • Clumsy: -1 to Keep Them Busy and Finish Them

Armor Tags

  • Armor X: Absorb X damage before taking stat damage
  • Tough: Ignore Slow and Clumsy tags from weapons

Item Tags

  • Healing: Use to heal 1 damage
  • Food: Can Fill Your Belly with this
  • Drunk: Makes you roll with Despair until you Recover
  • Use X: Limited uses, gone when empty

Quick Move Guide

Need info? → Look Closely / Speak Softly
Avoid danger? → Overcome (reactive) / Get Away (escape)
Buy time? → Keep Them Busy
Get help? → Talk Sense
End fight? → Finish Them (need Advantage!)

Advancement

Level Up when: Answer 3 End of Session questions

  • Did we learn something important about the world?
  • Did we overcome a notable enemy or obstacle?
  • Did we save a community or place from a dire fate?

Choose from playbook advancement options

Your Role as Overlord

You are: The villain, the referee, and the world Your job: Keep it interesting, keep it flowing, make sure everyone has fun

Overlord's Agenda

  • Create Opportunities To Do Good - Give them people to save and a broken world to fix
  • Play To Find Out What Happens - Don't plan beyond your current schemes, roll with developments

Overlord's Principles

  • Create problems, not solutions
  • Address characters, not players
  • Never speak their names, only their people
  • Give everyone a turn in the Spotlight
  • Ask lots of questions and build on the answers
  • Be a fan of the characters
  • Think off-screen too
  • Look at your Foibles

Overlord Stats (Different from Players!)

Your stats are truths about you while undamaged:

Examples:

  • Invincible: Cannot be hurt
  • Made Of Fire: Touch burns and scars
  • Charming: No one believes you're evil
  • Flight: Ground cannot hold you
  • Terrifying: Where you go, no Hope
  • Phantom: Pass through walls/attacks
  • Rich: Can buy anyone/anything
  • Warrior: Unbeatable in combat

Start with 3 stats of your choice
Fellowship knows all your stats - they must counter each one

Overlord Damage

  • To damage you: They must pay a price for each undamaged stat first
  • If destroyed: Damage a stat instead (no cost to attacker)
  • All stats damaged + more damage: Finally defeated
  • Sources of Power seized: They can erase one stat forever

Overlord Basic Moves

An Offer You Can't Refuse

Trigger: Player gets Taken Out in your presence
Give them an offer for services/possessions/life
If they accept: Fulfill deal, leave scene
If they refuse: They roll +Courage

  • 10+: They spite you AND escape
  • 7-9: They spite you, then you punish them (may kill)
  • 6-: They must accept against their will

Chew The Scenery

When physically present: Keep Spotlight as long as you want
You and Generals: Never roll with Despair

Forge a Bond (Overlord version)

When you cause great personal harm: Forge Bond with them
Your Bonds: Only erased by your Moves, unlimited number
When you reveal unexpected vulnerability: They may Bond with you (can't erase these)

Heart of Fire

When player has Bond with you: They can erase it for reprieve:

  • You show mercy
  • Tell them something valuable
  • Ignore them temporarily

Heart of Iron

When someone moves against you: Erase Bond with them to:

  • Make them auto-fail roll
  • Steal Spotlight

  • Twist the Knife against them
    Rest of fellowship can act freely while you focus on them

Twist the Knife

When speaking to someone you're Bonded with about shared history:
Force them to relive pain. They choose:

  • Pay a price
  • Stand down and get out of way

  • Attack you right now
    No matter what: Make Hard Cut against them

Threat to the World

Anyone not also a Threat must pay price to take direct action against you

Cut Them Real Bad

When physically present: Your Cuts can be as hard as you want

The Cut System

Soft Cuts (Most Common)

  • Give fellowship chance to react
  • Ask "What do you do?" after describing threat
  • Use when players look to you for what happens next
  • Start every scene with Soft Cut

Hard Cuts (Consequences)

  • Already happened, no reaction possible
  • Use when player fails to stop Soft Cut
  • Use on any 6- roll as hard as you want
  • Follow through on threatened consequences

Basic Cuts (Always Available)

Choose from:

  • Deal damage to someone
  • Put someone on the spot ("While you're doing that...")
  • Separate them (collapse rooms, kidnap someone)
  • Reveal unwelcome truth about world/situation
  • Show signs of approaching threat
  • Take away something important
  • Make them pay for reckless behavior
  • Advance your plans - your Master Plan moves forward

Master Plan System

You have 2-3 Master Plans active
Each plan has steps leading to completion
When you Advance Plans: Move one step forward
When plan completes: Gain major advantage, start new plan

Overlord Foibles (Your Weaknesses)

You are arrogant: Every setback is minor, you cannot lose
You have a Master Plan: You cannot directly act against fellowship until Plan advances far enough
You have a Weakness: Something the fellowship can exploit to hurt you

Managing NPCs & Threats

Generals

  • Your most powerful lieutenants
  • Have their own stats and moves
  • Can act independently
  • You can recruit more by leveling up

Regular Threats

  • Use their listed moves when appropriate
  • Combine multiple threats for complex scenes
  • Remember their specific abilities and limitations

Spotlight Management

Swing spotlight to:

  • Whoever has an idea
  • Someone in immediate danger
  • Player who hasn't acted recently
  • Character whose skills are needed now

Keep spotlight moving - don't let one player dominate

Quick Scene Flow

  1. Set the Scene - Describe location, situation
  2. Set the Stakes - What's the problem/danger?
  3. Swing Spotlight - Who acts first?
  4. React to Moves - Make Cuts when appropriate
  5. Keep It Moving - Always ask "What do you do?"

Session Structure

  • Start: Set scene, establish stakes
  • During: Swing spotlight, react to moves, advance plans

  • End: Check if fellowship answers three questions:

    • Learn something important about world?
    • Overcome notable enemy/obstacle?
    • Save community from dire fate?

If yes to all three: Fellowship levels up

Common Pitfalls to Avoid

  • Don't make plans beyond current scene
  • Don't kill fellowship without giving them chances
  • Don't ignore your Foibles - use them!
  • Don't forget to advance your plans
  • Don't let one player hog spotlight
  • Remember: You want them to eventually win, but not easily
